SENT.plain: Acute viral hepatitis with hepatitis A, B, C, D, and E viruses in the etiology of fulminant hepatic failure either single or in combinations has been described
Parvovirus B19 is also an etiologic agent of acute liver failure and hepatitis-associated aplastic anemia
We present a patient diagnosed with fulminant hepatitis A referred for liver transplantation
Parvovirus B19 superinfection was detected when the patient developed anemia during the course of the disease
We discuss possible roles of both viruses in fulminant hepatitis and pure red cell aplasia
